Reviews.Title: Edge lit with bright background
Reviews.Author: David G Carter
Reviews.Content: You used to be told if the screen was true LED array technology, which produces blacker blacks and brighter colors; or edge lit, which are a slimmer alternative to regular LCD screens.  I just got one of these after the shop rep (not Amazon) insisted it was a dynamic LED array system.  Not so.  As soon as you switch it on, you can see the bright blobby backdrop produced by the diffuser screen and the edge lighting.  And the Westinghouse web site freely admits that all its "LED" screens are of the more economical edge illuminated type.  I really wanted the most current technology, even if I had to pay more or buy a smaller screen, so its going back.  But movie quality is OK and price is good for a user who is happy with LCD type screens.I found the base a bit fussy to assemble, but then realized you can put the foot plate on backwards and it looks snug, but the screws don't fit.  Flip the plate and it assembles fine.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Top Ramen
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is a phenomenal LED TV.  I didn't spend a ton of $$ for a smart TV with cutting edge technology and top of the line features.  I just wanted a beater TV that was still better than the one (older CRT) I had before, without breaking the bank.  It also didn't have sharp corners the way several other flat panels do have - important for handling/moving purposes and for having kids around.  This TV also did not have it's name light up on the frame that many other TV's have which distract from viewing whatever's on the screen.  As an added bonus, my young daughters like the logo which unintentionally resembles a crown.
